feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 02 at 2:33PM AKDT until October 03 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Additional accumulations of 1 to 3 inches expected through Tuesday morning for a storm total of 8 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 02 at 2:33PM AKDT until October 03 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Additional accumulations of 1 to 2 inches expected through Tuesday morning for a storm total of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 2:22PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snowfall Expected for the Eastern Interior and Alaska Range through Tuesday... The forecast continues to be on track with significant slow totals in the Eastern Alaska Range, including the Richardson Highway Corridor through Tuesday morning. Snow is continuing to move east today and is on track to gradually diminish from west to east
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp; Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Tanana Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 10:02AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT... Strong northwesterly winds up to 40 mph have developed across Shelikof Strait. These winds are resuspending ash from the 1912 Katmai-Novarupta eruption. The villages of Karluk and Larsen Bay are most likely to be impacted. Ash is currently north of Akhiok,

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 3:52AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Dense Fog in the Valleys of the Southern Tier... Locally dense fog will persist in the valleys of the Southern Tier into the morning commute. If traveling early this morning, including along I-86, prepare for patches of dense fog that will drop visibility to less than one-half mile at times. If you encounter the fog, use the low-beam setting on headlights.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued October 03 at 1:42AM CDT until October 03 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTH CENTRAL GAINES COUNTY... At 142 AM CDT, Earlier emergency management reported flooding at Highway 385 and 83E. The thunderstorm has moved out of the warning area but between 1 and 2 inches of rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is expected to continue through the night.

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued October 02 at 10:04PM CDT until October 03 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding. Tides running around 1 to 1.5 feet above predicted astronomical tide levels. * WHERE...In Louisiana, West Cameron, East Cameron, Southern Calcasieu, Lower Vermilion, Lower Iberia and Lower St. Mary Parishes. In Texas, Lower Jefferson and Southern Orange

entry.title: Coastal Flood Statement issued October 02 at 8:25AM CDT until October 03 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Isolated minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island Counties. * WHEN...From 4 PM CDT this afternoon through late tonight.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued October 03 at 4:38AM AST until October 03 at 4:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Despite the expected rains, heat indices of 108 to 111 degrees Fahrenheit are likely. * WHERE...The urban and coastal sections in Puerto Rico, Culebra, Vieques and the US Virgin Islands. * WHEN...Through 4 PM AST this afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:58PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PERIODS OF STRONG GUSTY WINDS POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY MORNING... A strong cold front will move across the region and into the plains today. South winds this morning will shift into the west later today into tonight through early Tuesday morning with brief gusts around 55 to 60 MPH possible, especially between mile
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 02 at 2:29PM MDT until October 03 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected, mainly above 8,000 feet. Snow accumulation will vary greatly with elevation. Generally 3 to 6 inches between 8,500 feet and 9,500 feet. Higher amounts over a foot possible above 10,000 feet.
